word:
We come to Devil's Slide. Here are flat rocks set up like gravestones of nearly equal depth, running from the river up the mountainside a quarter of a mile above us. The stones are from fifty to one hundred feet high.-- Letter 20, 1873, pp. 1, 2. (To Edson and Emma White, Dec. 27, 1873.) 

White Estate Washington, D. C. April 27, 1981
